title: API - If it's not running, what do we do
text: API - If it's not running, what do we do? 27 May 2022 16:06 If a customer calls in with API-problems, we need the following information from them: We need to know which endpoint was called and with what data (payload). If they have a problem saving sales, we need to know the endpoint together with at least one example of a receipt, that contains the error, including all data about the receipt (client, date, pos, receipt number, all lines from the receipt). If they have a problem retrieving data, we need to know the endpoint together with the data called through the endpoint. E.g. customer counter numbers for a given period of time can be called through an API through the following: Endpoint: /api/people counter/{shopId}/{from}/{to} Payload: Client ID(shopId) - e.g. 56002, Date from – e.g. 29/07/2020 Date to – e.g. 05/08/2020 We need all this information to be able to test (both endpoint and payload). The customer cannot be expected to have this information – instead they should ask their integrator, who should then contact us. Be aware that 'our' registers also deliver sales through API. If a POS fails in connection with transferring sales information, this should be treated as usual (a POS-case) After we have received this information, the case should be sent to Development and an e-mail should be sent to integrations.europe@k3btg.com containing the same information.
description:
API - If it's not running, what do we do?

27 May 2022

16:06

 

If a customer calls in with API-problems, we need the following information from them:

 

We need to know which endpoint was called and with what data (payload).

 

If they have a problem saving sales, we need to know the endpoint together with at least one example of a receipt, that contains the error, including all data about the receipt (client, date, pos, receipt number, all lines from the receipt).

 

If they have a problem retrieving data, we need to know the endpoint together with the data called through the endpoint. E.g. customer counter numbers for a given period of time can be called through an API through the following:

 

Endpoint: /api/people counter/{shopId}/{from}/{to}              

 

Payload:                  

 

  • Client ID(shopId) - e.g. 56002,                                     
  • Date from – e.g. 29/07/2020        
  • Date to – e.g. 05/08/2020              

 

 

We need all this information to be able to test (both endpoint and payload).

 

The customer cannot be expected to have this information – instead they should ask their integrator, who should then contact us.

 

Be aware that 'our' registers also deliver sales through API. If a POS fails in connection with transferring sales information, this should be treated as usual (a POS-case)

 

After we have received this information, the case should be sent to Development and an e-mail should be sent to integrations.europe@k3btg.com containing the same information.
